newsitem.title: INDIA: Weizman to discuss phone deal during India visit.
newsitem.headline: Weizman to discuss phone deal during India visit.

text.p: An Israeli delegation led by President Ezer Weizman will discuss joint business ventures including a telephone services deal during a week-long visit to India next week, Indian diplomats said on Friday.
Weizmann is scheduled to arrive in New Delhi but will begin on Monday a six-day official visit which would focus on more than 100 joint ventures, mostly in agriculture, they said.

The visit by Weizman and an accompanying business delegation will mark a new high in relations that have strengthened since India established diplomatic relations with Israel in 1992 after decades of Cold War suspicions linked to the Palestine question.

India's business relations with Israel appeared to reach a new high after Himachal Futuristic Communications Ltd, a joint venture in which Israel's state-run Bezeq Telecom holds 49 percent, won tenders to set up telephone services in nine Indian zones under New Delhi's economic liberalisation programme.

But HFCL ran into a legal dispute with the Indian government over financial modalities when it was expected to bag licences to set up telephone services in four of the zones. India had put a ceiling on the number of licences a company can operate.
"It is (the Bezeq licence) still in a formative state. It has to be formalised," K Raghunath, a senior Foreign Ministry official told reporters in New Delhi.
India and Israel are expected to sign four agreements during Weizmann's visit, including one on agriculture, besides cultural and technical agreements, officials said.

Indian companies have shown a keen in interest to form joint ventures with Israeli counterparts to make drip irrigation equipment. Indian officials say Israel's water-conservation technology could be of immense use in India's dry zones.
